english_definitions: to be able (in a position) to do
to be up to the task
to be away from (e.g. one's house)

info: esp. 止める, 停める
esp. 止める, 停める
esp. 止める, 停める

english_definitions: to send out (on the airwaves, etc.)
to close (e.g. book, eyes, meeting, etc.)
to cause to meet (e.g. an unpleasant fate)
to push one's way through (a crowd)
to call on someone (e.g. in class)
to make a hit (e.g. in a lottery)
to hold (one's head) in one's hands
to be burdened with (e.g. care of a family member)
to have (children, etc.) to provide for
to include (in an anthology, catalogue, etc.)
to offer (to a shrine, deity, etc.)
to give (esp. to someone of lower status)
to pass (a variable to a function)

info: 獲る esp. refers to catching wild game, etc.

english_definitions: to receive something undesirable (e.g. a punishment)

info: after the -masu stem of a verb

english_definitions: to be broken off (e.g. of a relationship)
to be able to do completely
info: after the -masu stem of a verb

english_definitions: to move out of the way
to come off (of a button, handle, lid, etc.)
to go away (of a fever, pain, swelling, etc.)
to be attained (of balance, harmony, etc.)
to leave (a matter, decision, etc. to someone)
to leave (to chance, one's imagination, etc.)
to use (money, strength, spare time, etc.) to the full

info: as 〜に手を触れる, 〜に口を触れる, etc.

english_definitions: to be resolved (of a dispute, misunderstanding, etc.)
to keep in touch (e.g. with the enemy)
to recommend (a book, someone for a position, etc.)
to offer (a drink, cigarette, seat, etc.)
to be missing (from a set, team, etc.)

info: oft. as どう転んでも

english_definitions: to abandon Christianity (and convert to Buddhism)
(for a geisha) to prostitute (herself) in secret
to grow (of hair, height, grass, etc.)
to stretch out (e.g. of a hand)
to be prolonged (meeting, life span, etc.)
to expire (of a period of time)
to be transparent (e.g. of the sky)

info: usu. as 抜けた or 抜けている

english_definitions: to finish a round with more than 88 points (not counting points gained from scoring combinations)
to take up (a topic, complaint, etc.)
to corner (esp. an opponent's king in shogi)
to cut off (one's finger as an act of apology)
to catch (one's finger in a door, etc.)
info: the meaning "to catch one's finger" is predominantly used in Kansai

english_definitions: to force someone into a difficult situation by ...
to go wrong (of a plan or expectation, etc.)
to go crazy (over someone or something)
to leave (a matter) in someone's hands

info: after the -masu stem of a verb

english_definitions: to sink below the surface and become unable to breathe
to lose one's head over something
